lenders.name: Rachel
lenders.loan_because:
It is paying it forward!  Plus, my $25 or more can really go far for someone in another country.  Once I get it back I'll lend it to someone else . . . 
----------
I've made at least a year long commitment to Kiva starting Nov. 1, 2010. Each month (and hopefully each paycheck every two weeks), I will lend $25 to a loan.  I'm lucky enough to be able to give -- and believe that I can give $50 a month to make a difference.  
--------
May 1, 2012 - a year and a half later I'm still going strong with a new $25 loan every paycheck!  Is that a committment you could make to Kiva entrepreneurs worldwide?
-----
July 2013 - still loaning a new loan every two weeks with each paycheck.  Monthly repayments have gotten bigger and bigger and I'm even more "addicted" to Kiva!
lenders.occupational_info: Helping individuals and families get through the troubles of life!

These women realized that education was the key to a better life and while they asked nothing for themselves, their dream was to make enough money to send their children to school. lenders.loan_because: I am also a business owner and know the value of a loan to start and grow a business.  I started with a $190,000 loan in 1990 to buy a historic home to rent out for weddings and other events.  I now have 2 houses and several other related side businesses that are worth over $4.5 million with an annual income of over $1.4 million.  I mostly want to help other women start and grow business not only to help their lives and families but also to become respected business owners and great examples in their communities.
lenders.occupational_info: I own 2 buildings which I rent out to people for their weddings and other events.  I also provide many of the other items they need such as tables, chairs, linens, tableware, etc. for these events.  I expanded my business to also include 2 rooms for overnight accommodations, sales of invitations, honeymoon travel and full service event planning.  I have 8 full time and 30 part time employees.  I have won many awards and have become an important and respected business person in my community and my business has become one of the most respected in the wedding and event industry in my state of Colorado USA.  I am married and have a 22 year old son who also works for me part time while he attends collage.  My son and his girlfriend live on the same 10 acre property as my business, myself and my husband built a beautiful home on this same property and I am currently in the process of building my parents new home here as well.  I have a 5 year collage degree in design and love what I do!
